message.content:
```
d1y5 | We can generalise that:
rl20 | Eco- or Biotic Potential: The full genetic potential of a species population in all ecological matters.
t91r | Fundamental Niche: Phenotype limited by environmental factors and physical constraints currently shaping the genotype; for example, the temperature or food type range of an organism.
7s4b | Realized Niche: Phenotype limited by biotic interactions equals competition, predation, parasitism; for example, the population growth of an organism after predators have reduced it.
ehif | The Niche Theory - Niche Dimensions & Fitness
buv0 | (a) One Dimension:
wqqa | Abiotic: Temperature
www8 | The Niche Theory - Niche Dimensions & Fitness
zhvt | Resource Utilisation Curve (Resource Gradient equals Seed size, Fruit ripeness, Tree height etc.)
yv1q | Species Response Curve (Environmental Gradient equals Temperature, pH, Salinity etc.)
u7jx | Note that only one dimension is shown on these ‘bell-shaped curves'.
03u9 | The Niche Theory - Niche Dimensions & Fitness
8sqd | Graphical expressions of multidimensional niches can also incorporate fitness
vlyz | Again with more than three niche dimensions this becomes increasingly problematic to show in graphic diagrams.
5034 | Examples are shown below: (a) Fitness highest at X equals five point five units;
9lvu | Y equals three point zero (b) Fitness highest at
uy7a | The Niche Theory - Niche Dimensions & Fitness
lqs6 | Summarizing the Overall Levels of Ecological (Foraging) Niche Dimensions
ri4s | Summary of Lecture Three - The Basis of the Ecological Niche Concept
2j8o | One. Historically the Niche Concept was initiated and developed about one hundred years ago
qrl1 | Grinnel: Geographical-spatial distributional unit of a species
uvvk | Elton: Trophic-foraging positioning of a species in the ecosystems
mdnj | Hutchinson: The first comprehensive n-dimensional hyper volume
mwy0 | Begon-Krebs-Ricklefs: Further advancing of Hutchinson's Polechová and Storch: Duality - both position and role in ecosystems
hg8q | Two. Species Niches are controlled by Dynamic Ecological Interactions:
rcyg | Abiotic components: Climatic conditions, chemical-physical environment
bj8l | Biotic components: Competitors, parasites, predators-prey, disease
cygk | Summary of Lecture Three - The Basis of the Ecological Niche Concept
rtk7 | Three. Three types defined within the Theory of the ecological Niche Concept:
1wc3 | Eco or Biotic Potential: Absolute maximum potentiality - genotype determined
333g | Fundamental: Actual uncontested, resource unlimited - phenotype determined
6kja | Realized: Actual in the presence of other biotic interactors - resource limited
fmi5 | Four. Three major Niche Dimensions: Trophic (food), Spatial (area), Temporal (time)
bqn5 | Objectives of lecture Four - Theory and Concept of the Ecological Niche
4lyq | One. An introduction to Niche Width - populations and individual morphs:
jzqz | What is the effect of phenotypic traits on niche width and shape?
0uje | Two. An Overview of interspecies niche relationship and positioning:
apx3 | Included niches: Which are inferior and which are superior?
kcrm | Abutting niches: How limited is competition such as in Contiguous Allopatry?
mbsp | Overlapping niches: How much can niches overlap before exclusion results?
zynb | Three. A Comparison of Niche Overlap and Competition:
8h0u | Interspecific: The relationship between species density and niche width.
b09f | Four. An Account of the rules for Niche Width, Overlap and Limiting Similarity:
zutp | Diffuse Competition: Additive competitors may drive exclusion from Niche.
qgmy | Niche Theory - Niche Width and Overlap (One)
40wi | Natural populations have variability in both resource use and diversity of morphs
a418 | (b) Between Phenotype Component: morphological diversity of a population.
e9lu | Niche width (W) equals Within Phenotype Component plus Between Phenotype Component
a278 | If Within Phenotype Component is high then the population consists of mono or oligo-morph generalists (a)
ffto | If Between Phenotype Component is high then the population consists of poly-morph specialists (b)
ak21 | (a) Intraspecific: Increased population density (Low to High) increases competition among individuals for limited resources (food and space), forcing individuals to search for and adapt to other opportunities equals increasing niche width.
i7n1 | (b) Interspecific: Increased competition between species force these to reduce niche overlap or segregate niches by virtue of specialisation equals decreasing niche width (narrow niches allow more dense packing of species in communities).
m9yn | Niche Theory - Niche Width and Overlap (Three)
cg8u | Possible niche relationships of two species (Species One, Species Two and Species Three; one niche dimension):
2hsv | (A) Included, (B) Overlapping, (C) Abutting, (D) Disjunct niches.
7s7l | Niche Theory - Niche Width and Overlap (Four)
uwdf | Realized Niche (G) equals
jjgp | G equals brackets (A plus B plus C plus D plus E plus F) divided by G close brackets
df4g | Diffuse competition of several species on a single species.
qc2j | The fundamental niche of species G is greatly reduced by subtracting the overlapping fundamental niches of species A through F.
x3oh | This illustrates how several species may squeeze out another species by this cumulative or diffuse competition.
fqvx | No competition (disjunct): D divided by W greater than three, Invasion of adjacent species:
viae | Objectives - Differential Niche overlap and Complementarity
p8u9 | One. An Introduction to the concept of niche overlap and interspecific competition:
49ky | How does spatio-temporal variation on food availability affect trophic niche?
p5wo | Which mechanisms separate species to limit similarity and segregate niches?
74rp | Two. An Overview of various modes of differential niche overlap
oolg | How does various means of niche segregations operate?
3ewf | What are the relationships among trophic and spatio-temporal niche division?
5iea | Three. An Account of relationships between niche dimensionality and complementarity:
62l5 | What is the effect of increasing niche dimensions and complementarity?
shub | What are the basic rules for complementarity and niche dimensionality?
zjn5 | How does niche differentiation and complementarity increase coexistence?
w8ia | Four. A Comparison of ways in which niches are partitioned at the community level:
4vej | What are the basic rules (Hutchinson's) of community wide niche partitioning?
8ut1 | Differential Niche Overlap and Complementarity (One)
6o35 | Categories of species separation along complementary resource dimensions
8r63 | One. Food type and habitat - species showing overlap in habitat eat different foods, or vice versa
qze0 | Two. Food type and time - species use the same food at different times or different foods at the same time
o3m2 | Three. Habitat and time - species uses the same habitat at different times or different habitats at the same time
kro9 | Four. Habitat and habitat - species overlapping in horizontal habitat often differ in vertical habitat or vice versa
i438 | Five. Food type and food type - species may eat similar-sized foods but different species or types, or vice versa
yr7b | Differential Niche Overlap and Complementarity (Two)
60hk | Seasonal (temporal) variation in habitat and dietary overlap among granivorous birds in an Arizonian grassland equals spatio-temporal dietary niche segregation:
5djf | Rainy Season (food plenty): Birds specialize on a seed type across overlapping habitat types
hem5 | Dry Season (food scarce): Birds specialize on separate habitats foraging on many seed types
vfd9 | Differential Niche Overlap and Complementarity (Three)
jkgk | Differential Niche Overlap between Four hypothetical species (A, B, C, D)
8nom | Horizontal niche dimension considered alone: Species C is apparently in trouble facing diffuse competition from both B and D - coexistence doubtful.
vsjd | Vertical niche dimension considered alone: Species C subject to heavy niche overlap with A, and moderate overlap from B - coexistence doubtful.
tucm | Both Niche dimensions considered simultaneously
prly | Resulting Niche Space
2epy | A, B, C versus D disjunct
v55t | A versus B disjunct
53fa | A and C abutting
nnb3 | Only little overlap between species B and C
s943 | Differential Niche Overlap and Complementarity (Four)
o7zd | Foraging Techniques of Five sympatric Bird Species in Oak Forest
```
